text: How do I create & assign new roles for my users? There is roles key in context.users but I cannot find any mention of roles in the settings. Closest thing is permission sets, but I'm currently logged in as a super admin then why is roles still empty.
Is there not a crm.objects.invoices.write? I will need to update the invoice so that it's paid after the transaction is processed to kick off post-payment triggers.
I have tried but getting domain in both the area
The scopes in your URLS don’t match the scope in the app.

Not at the moment. the Payments team realized the read access a couple of months ago.

Write access is coming down the line but not sure. Maybe <@U04U9UFTKNJ> can provide some input.

Is there a way to somewhere get something like a name, subject line or something for Marketing Emails if I have a list of `Content IDs`?
`GET*/marketing/v3/emails/*`  does not return anything useful which could be used for linking.

Well, I am a payment processor. My current project for current HubSpot customers is not going to go live until I have that. So maybe we have to get the bigger clients of HubSpot to advocate for this. It's okay that Stripe can do all this, but other processors can't. I would love for everyone to just get along and work together.

Hey y’all, question on public app monitoring: when I look in the logs in my developer account, I’m seeing “No body was recorded for this request,” but in the workflow logs (in the account actually running the action) the request body is clearly there. This is the case for all other types of requests to the HS API as well, not just the workflow callback endpoint. Do you see something I’m missing here?
Ty would you be open to connecting next week? I work on our GTM efforts for Commerce Hub and would love to hear more about what’s on your mind on this front if you’d be open to it
I can't wait.

For successful responses HTTP 2XX the body is not recorded.
For unsuccessful ones you would have the request body and response  headers + body captured in the logs for debugging purposes.
Mmmm thanks that’s good to know
:clap:
<@U07CUL3HLL9> I’m confused. `/marketing/v3/emails/` provides the `name` and `subject`  in the response results field.
You can also call the individual endpoint `marketing/v3/emails/:emailId` to get the same data.

Hey guys. I have a major time-sensitive problem. All my new oauths are running into this error:
```This oauth-token (xxx) does not have proper permissions! (requires any of [forms-write])```
I can't find anything about forms-write on the web, or under scopes.
Yes but how do I link a Content ID back to the output of `/marketing/v3/emails/` ?
it’s `id`
An Email ID ist NOT the Content ID

in the response, `id` is the ID of the email.

If you take `<https://app.HubSpot.com/email/{portal}/edit/{id}/content>`  it will load the email.
that ID then could be used in Workflows
Does that help?
yeah that scope doesn’t exist. Are you trying to refresh tokens or get connect new accounts?
Connect new accounts
Can you share a screenshot of your scope within your app and the scope url?

Hello everyone! Is there a way to modify custom event properties after they have been submitted? I want to record meeting attendance data with a custom event, including the time the user joined and left, as well as the percentage of time attended. However, Zoom has two different webhooks for join and leave events in meetings. Therefore, I was wondering if I can trigger the attendance event first with the join time, and then update it when the second Zoom webhook triggers with the leave time.

And here is the URL (local testing): <https://app.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=dd90b058-4b9a-499e-8fe3-3d75fbae6c0b&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Fapp.localhost%3A5173%2Fauth%2FHubSpot%2Fcallback&scope=crm.schemas.deals.read+timeline+forms+files+tickets+crm.objects.contacts.write+crm.objects.companies.write+crm.objects.companies.read+crm.objects.deals.read+crm.schemas.contacts.read+crm.objects.deals.write+crm.objects.contacts.read+crm.schemas.companies.read|https://app.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=dd90b058-4b9a-4[…]ls.write+crm.objects.contacts.read+crm.schemas.companies.read>
I noticed that scopes in your URL are separated by `+` and mine are `%20`

An example of mine:
```&scope=crm.schemas.contacts.write%20automation%20oauth%20forms```
I don't think that would make a difference. I am using the URL class to construct the URL, and it has been working fine for years now.
okay. that was just the first thing I noticed.
I like simple problems! :smile:
I wish it was! Do you work for HubSpot?

I just clicked your link:
Try to finish the OAUTH with this access-token:
```a6c22c52-1f21-4db8-8e37-36c6a5625b8a```
Nope, just a random person trying to help you.
The oauth itself is working. I am able to access other objects.
The issue is specifically with updating forms.

Someone else raised this issue once, but I can't seem to find anything else on this: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Granular-scope-migration-Forms-scope-not-working/m-p/549980?profile.language=pt-br>
Thanks for helping me out here!
<@UD53A9UUR> see the link :point_up: and how you dug into the granular scope migration issue for forms and some odd scope named `forms-write`.
I have been using granular scopes for a while. The problem is that forms-write isn't a scope at all (granular or not). The only scope I can enable is called 'forms'
right.
my app also uses the forms scope.
i’m testing locally with the update.

Are you able to update forms with that? I was definitely able to. Odd enough, it works with some accounts and not with others. It works with my main account, but I created a new trial account and it fails there.
yea I just was able to create a form, then update with only the scope of `form`.
Is the trial account created through your developer account or some other way?
No, just a regular signup
ohhh maybe something is up with the trial account
like it’s not able to create forms or something.
use this from the developer account.
Think I found it "*Give more information to get full access to HubSpot"*
ahhhh
Yep that was it!
yo!
:boom:
Thanks for your help. HubSpot should pay you!
i came at the perfect time
dennis fixed it!
Nishant, I appreciate that comment but no need to be paid.
Dennis re-wired something and now it's all peachy
we pay justin with l~ove~ chickens
plus Dennis would pay with chickens.
